result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:02 AM w/ Cases: 21CF377, 21CF162, 21CF27, 22CF270 & 22CF233// Defendant Stacy L Lindert in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger appeared by phone for Stacy L Lindert and Attorney Kate Findley appeared in person. Attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews cases and statuses. Attorney Klomberg makes statement in regards to representation issue. Attorney Luchsinger is not able to represent Defendant. Attorney Luchsinger makes statement to the Court in regards to his representation, he states that he has submitted a proposed order and asks the Court to sign the Order. Attorney Klomberg does not wish to proceed with 22CF270 and 22CF233 without representation. Court takes short recess for discussion at 11:12 AM; Court resumes at 11:29 AM, appearances remain the same. The Court has received a PQWOR and Stipulation for Cases 21CF27, 21CF162 & 21CF377. Attorney Findley represents that the SPD office will be assigning someone to represent the Defendant in 22CF270 and 22CF233.

The PQWOR in cases 21CF377, 21CF162 & 21CF27 was reviewed with the Defendant. Court reviews charges and maximum penalties of each offense with the Defendant. Defendant pleads NO CONTEST in: 21CF377: Count 1-Poss. w/ Intent to Amphetamine, Counts 2 thru 8 are DISMISSED AND READ IN. NO CONTEST in 21CF162: Count 1 Poss. of Meth & Count 3: OWI (3), Counts 2, 4, 5 and 6 are DISMISSED AND READ IN. NO CONTEST in 21CF27: Count 1: Poss of Meth, Counts 2 thru 6 are DISMISSED AND READ IN. As part of plea agreement the enhancers have been removed from all charges the Defendant is pleading to. Court accepts the Defendants pleas and finds the Defendant GUILTY.

Court orders a PSI in 21CF377, 21CF162 & 21CF27 and completed by 12-7-22.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Withdraw
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:00PM Called 22CF270 and 22CF233.  Defendant Stacy L Lindert appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Teri Strohschein appears by video - eligible. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $10,000 cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Payment of warrant fees by next court date if requested. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
